column1: Ministry of Commerce and Industry Seek to Promote India–Africa Trade

In order to promote India-Africa trade and economic relation, Ministry of Commerce and Industry regular viewfinder’s trade with Africa through institutional mechanism Joint Commission Meeting (Jcs), Joint Trade Committee (Jcs), and Joint Working Group(Jg).

The 9th Session of the India-Kenya Joint Trade Committee was held in New Delhi on 19-20 August, 2019 under the co-chairmanship of Minister of Commerce and Industry, Pius Goya and his Kenyan counterpart Mr.Peter Bunyan, Cabinet Secretary (Minister) for Ministry of Industry, Trade and Cooperative, Government of the Republic of Kenya.  During the meeting, wide ragging discussion were held cutting across sector like MME, Agriculture, Information Communication Technology (DICT), Tourism, Administration of Standard, Development of Human Resource in Highers Education, Science & Technology, Investment Promotion and Protection, Air Service, Energy, Plastic, Textile, Pharmaceutical, Oil & Gas, Health, Immigration, Automobile and other engineering product
Collaboration in the field of issue of recognition of Indian Pharmacopoeia in Kenya was also rediscussed.
The First India-Nigeria ETC was held on 19th – 20th December, 2019 in New Delhi, under the Co-chair of Commerce Secretary, Government of India and his Nigerian counterpart

During the meeting discussion were held in various sector inclining oil and natural gas, market access in bovine meat, rice, recognition of pharmacopoeia, cooperation of SAME sector, highers education and power.

The first meeting of the India-South Africa J on Trade and Investment was held in January, 2019, to deliberate upon the bottleneck inclining non-tariff barrier, and suggest the way forward to further deepen India’s trade with the region.
The propose India-Mauritius Comprehensive Economic Cooperation and Partnership Agreement (CECA)seek to mutuality benefit both the mounties, in the area of trade in good, and trade in service
